programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Kyron Drones leads the Hokies into their ACC test against the Orange. Drones has thrown five touchdown passes over the last three games. Syracuse has lost two straight, at then-No. 14 North Carolina and at No. 4 Florida State, by a combined 81-10.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Kyron Drones leads the Hokies into their ACC test against the Orange. Drones has thrown five touchdown passes over the last three games. Syracuse has lost two straight, at then-No. 14 North Carolina and at No. 4 Florida State, by a combined 81-10.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Heat and Celtics write another chapter of a storied rivalry. The two sides have met in three of the past four Eastern Conference finals, and six times in the postseason since 2010. Miami won the East after nearly coughing up a 3-0 lead to Boston.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Sacramento begins its home slate versus Golden State. In 2022-23, the Warriors won a seven-game first-round playoff set against the Kings in the first postseason meeting between California rivals. Sacramento's Mike Brown was named Coach of the Year.

programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Analysis, highlights and interviews.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Gamecocks (2-5, 1-4 SEC) try to start a streak versus the Aggies (4-3, 2-2). South Carolina took down Texas A&M 30-24 in 2022 for its first win in nine tries in the head-to-head set. Texas A&M comes off one-score losses to Alabama and Tennessee.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 18 Cardinals (6-1, 3-1) try to recover from their loss by hosting No. 20 Duke (5-2, 2-1) for an ACC affair. Louisville was stunned in its last game, 38-21 at Pittsburgh on Oct. 14. Duke comes off a 38-20 setback at No. 4 Florida State.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 21 Volunteers try to bounce back as they visit the Wildcats. Both teams are 5-2, 2-2 SEC. Tennessee lost at then-No. 11 Alabama 34-20 after leading 20-7 at halftime. The Volunteers racked up 89 points in winning the last two meetings.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The high-flying No. 11 Beavers (6-1, 3-1 Pac-12) line up against the Wildcats (4-3, 2-2). Oregon State is sporting the 12th-best offense in the nation at 38.1 points scored per game. Oregon State took down Arizona 56-38 in their last meeting in 2019.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 21 Volunteers try to bounce back as they visit the Wildcats. Both teams are 5-2, 2-2 SEC. Tennessee lost at then-No. 11 Alabama 34-20 after leading 20-7 at halftime. The Volunteers racked up 89 points in winning the last two meetings.

programme.title: Sunday NFL Countdown
programme.desc: This Sunday pregame staple debuted in 1985 and soon became a signature ESPN series. Host Samantha Ponder introduces the features and directs the storylines associated with the day's games, joined by a roster of analysts highlighted by ex-NFL players, coaches and executives including Tedy Bruschi, Randy Moss, Matt Hasselbeck, Rex Ryan and Louis Riddick. Chris Mortensen and Adam Schefter deliver breaking news and injury updates, while reporters at game sites set the scenes.

programme.title: Women's College Volleyball
programme.desc: From Hilton Coliseum in Ames, Iowa.

programme.title: Women's College Volleyball
programme.desc: From Alaska Airlines Arena in Seattle.

programme.title: Championship Drive
programme.desc: Led by host Kevin Connors, college football analysts and reporters meet to discuss and debate who the top teams are in the country.

programme.title: Red Bull BC One World Final 2023
programme.desc: The best b-boys and b-girls from around the world battle for the coveted Red Bull BC One World Championship title. From Paris.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Modern Day Hate is revitalized as Georgia State (6-1, 3-1 Sun Belt) lines up against Georgia Southern (5-2, 2-1). The Panthers lead the series 6-3. Georgia State, off to its best start in program history, defeated Louisiana Lafayette 20-17 in Week 8.

programme.title: ESPN FC
programme.desc: Highlights, news, reactions and opinions from the day in soccer.

programme.title: Fantasy Focus
programme.desc: Field Yates hosts ESPN's top Fantasy Football experts for a daily discussion of rankings, injuries and game previews and debate how the biggest NFL stories impact Fantasy Football.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: From Autodromo Hermanos Rodriguez in Mexico City.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: Daily Wager
programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight
programme.desc: If you're a fan of baseball, then you won't want to miss this show featuring highlights of all the games and updates of ones still in progress. Regularly hosted by Karl Ravech, he's joined by a rotating panel of analysts that includes former players and managers, plus reporters such as Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney. Other hosts include Adnan Virk and Jon Sciambi.

programme.desc: From Autodromo Hermanos Rodriguez in Mexico City.

programme.title: College Football Countdown
programme.desc: A look at the day's college football action, featuring news, highlights and game previews.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Jalon Jones and the 49ers host the Owls for an American Athletic Conference game. Jones rushed for 127 yards and a touchdown to help Charlotte snap a five-game slide, 10-7 at East Carolina in Week 8. Florida Atlantic has won four straight meetings.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Wildcats try for three in a row when the Cougars come to Manhattan, Kan. Kansas State trounced TCU 41-3 in a rematch of last season's Big 12 championship game Oct. 21. The Wildcats feature the top rushing attack of any Power Five program in 2023.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 22 Green Wave (6-1, 3-0) try to stay perched atop the American Athletic Conference as they welcome the Owls (4-3, 2-1) to the Big Easy. Tulane freshman Makhi Hughes totaled 374 rushing yards and four touchdowns over the last three games.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Ollie Gordon II and the Cowboys (5-2, 3-1 Big 12) try to run over the Bearcats (2-5, 0-4). Gordon II ranks eighth nationally with 816 rushing yards, and has totaled 586 on the ground with seven total TDs during Oklahoma State's three-game win streak.

programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Tom Brady and Charles Woodson reflect on the controversial play from a Raiders-Patriots playoff in January 2002 that impacted football history, keying Tom Brady's first postseason win and helping to launch a dynasty under coach Bill Belichick.

programme.desc: Highlights, news, reactions and opinions from the day in soccer.

programme.title: Bundesliga Soccer
programme.desc: Eintracht Frankfurt hosts Borussia Dortmund at Deutsche Bank Park in Bundesliga matchround nine. Frankfurt won one of its last 13 Bundesliga fixtures against Dortmund, a 2-1 victory at Signal Iduna Park on April 3, 2021 (winning goal by André Silva).

programme.title: Fantasy Football Now
programme.desc: "Fantasy Football Now" airs live on Sunday mornings during the NFL season, a time when fans are making last-minute roster moves and need the latest news from around the league. Providing the latest info are host Field Yates, analysts Mike Clay and Damien Woody, and senior writer and injury analyst Stephania Bell. Also contributing to the show are ESPN's NFL reporters, who bring fantasy players the latest intel from game sites and, in many cases, straight from the coach's mouth to give fantasy owners everything they need to know to set their lineups.

programme.title: Catching Hell
programme.desc: Citizens of Chicago blame baseball fan Steve Bartman for interfering with a crucial play during a Cubs playoff game.

programme.title: The Captain
programme.desc: Jeter has an instant impact on the Yankees as he captures a title in his first season as a pro. This catapults him to superstardom but fame comes with a price. Jeter reveals the privileges and perils of fame.

programme.title: The Captain
programme.desc: Jeter wins his 5th and final World Series and celebrates his 3000th hit, but it's not all smooth sailing for this aging superstar. He goes through a very public and difficult contract negotiation that changes his relationship with the Yankees.

programme.title: Golf
programme.desc: From Royal Melbourne Golf Club in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

programme.title: Championship Drive
programme.desc: Led by host Kevin Connors, college football analysts and reporters meet to discuss and debate who the top teams are in the country.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: Championship Drive
programme.desc: Led by host Kevin Connors, college football analysts and reporters meet to discuss and debate who the top teams are in the country.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Astros try to even the American League Championship Series against the Rangers in Game 2. Jonah Heim hit a second-inning single that cashed rookie Evan Carter, and Leody Taveras homered to pace Texas to a 2-0 victory and a series lead in Game 1.

programme.desc: A daily sports talk show hosted by Skip Bayless, where each day Skip is joined by a cast of NFL legends for passionate conversations about the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.desc: Craig Carton, one of New York's best-known voices, analyzes and debates the biggest headlines in sports each morning.

programme.desc: Colin Cowherd and co-host Jason McIntyre break down the biggest stories and interview the biggest guests in sports.

programme.title: 2023 World Series
programme.desc: The Diamondbacks play the Rangers in Game 1 of the World Series. Both clubs swept their first two playoff series. Adolís Garcia hit five home runs in the final four games of Texas' seven-game triumph over Houston en route to being named ALCS MVP.

programme.title: 2023 World Series
programme.desc: The Diamondbacks play the Rangers in Game 1 of the World Series. Both clubs swept their first two playoff series. Adolís Garcia hit five home runs in the final four games of Texas' seven-game triumph over Houston en route to being named ALCS MVP.

programme.title: Bassmaster Fishing Elite Series
programme.desc: Competition from the highest level of professional bass fishing tournaments.

programme.title: Big Noon Kickoff
programme.desc: Top college football games from the Big 12, Big Ten and Pac-12 conferences, beginning each Saturday with the brand-new Big Noon Kickoff pregame show on Fox.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Knights (3-4, 0-4 Big 12) and Mountaineers (4-3, 2-2) try to snap hard-luck streaks. UCF is still searching for its first conference win after suffering one- and two-point losses. West Virginia has dropped two straight despite totaling 73 points.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Cornhuskers try to keep rolling as they host the Boilermakers. Nebraska has won four of its last five after toppling Northwestern in Week 8. However, Purdue has claimed four of the last five meetings with Nebraska after prevailing 43-37 in 2022.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 5 Huskies seek their first 8-0 start in seven years when they line up against the Cardinal. Mishael Powell's 89-yard pick-six saved Washington's College Football Playoff hopes and secured a 15-7 triumph over Arizona State on Oct. 21.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Jayden Maiava and the red-hot Rebels (6-1, 3-0) visit the Bulldogs (6-1, 2-1) for a Mountain West affair. UNLV has won five straight. Maiava, a 6-foot-4 freshman from Las Vegas, has thrown for 754 yards and four touchdowns over the last three games.

programme.title: 2023 World Series
programme.desc: The Rangers and Diamondbacks play Game 2 of the 2023 World Series. Texas manager Bruce Bochy guided his third different franchise to the Fall Classic. Arizona is familiar with Bochy taking NL West rivals San Diego and San Francisco both to pennants.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: No. 6 Oklahoma (7-0, 4-0 Big 12) seeks its 19th straight victory over Kansas (5-2, 2-2). The Jayhawks last defeated the Sooners in 1997. Oklahoma kept its national championship hopes alive with a 31-29 triumph over upset-minded UCF last week.
